ygData.subject: Re: [RE: [eqbards] How do you play this game?]
ygData.msgSnippet: hehe my favorite newbie story is from beta A friend of mine and I (God we were rotten eggs) made characters named Banker and Teller We d stand in front of the
ygData.messageBody:
hehe my favorite newbie story is from beta

A friend of mine and I (God we were rotten eggs) made characters named
Banker and Teller

We'd stand in front of the actual bankers in freeport bank

I got about 35 plat before we got yelled at. My friend (banker) got over
100 plat :)

Was quite the scandal.

But we had fun doing it and had some really nice equipment for our "Real"
characters :) Gotta love the mad rush of Beta 4 folks that had never seen
the game before :)

I think Banker and Teller are in the "Bad name" database now ;) I was
thinking about making an Iksar banker just for old times sake but it
wouldn't let me reserve the name ;)

hehehe

Lyrnia
----- Original Message -----
From: "Webber, Jessica" <webber@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, April 20, 2000 3:06 PM
Subject: RE: [RE: [eqbards] How do you play this game?]


> Um, yeah I've got a dark elf. And yeah, point taken. It did take me a
> while to find my way out to Neriak. But the funniest experience I had
was
> with my barbarian. I got on the raft, floated across the lake, then got
> lost in the corridor to Everfrost because it was night & I had no lamp
yet.
> Somehow I got turned around and came back out to the lake. Figured it was
a
> dead end and wasted the next 20 minutes looking for the way out of Halas.
>
> In my defense I should say that I started the wood elf, the dark elf, the
> barbarian, and a few others right away. I've never had a primary. So all
> these little misadventures were during my first few playing hours.
>
> Come to think of it, Freeport was a tough town too...
>
> Peace
> Evulia, bard of 10 verses, Tunare
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Kevin L. Crawford [mailto:Lyrnia@...]

> > > My theory on that is that someone decided that Kelethin
> > should be the most
> > > difficult town in the game. It's easy to get lost. It's
> > easy to fall off
> > > if your unfamilar with it. And it's easy to get frustrated
> > as a newbie
> > when
> > > the elevator you've seen going up and down won't come down
> > when you get to
> > > the platform. (my first char was a wood elf bard, not
> > Evulia though, and
> > I
> > > honestly had no idea how the elevators worked. I think I
> > made it to level
> > > three before figuring it out)
> > >
> > > Peace
> > > Evulia, bard of 10 verses, Tunare
